comment: don't even buy the text book. The quizzes and tests are open note but you're timed so it kinda doesn't help. You have 10 minutes for 10 questions. and it's easy, but it's easy to get stuff wrong too, which losing points can add up. do the extra credit just in case. BUT DONT WASTE MONEY ON THE TEXTBOOK, just google stuff to be honest. easy class tho
Easy A, just do the work and turn it in.

He's a pretty harsh grader and doesn't give a ton of feedback to improve. Pretty understanding if you just talk to him but miss one assignment and you'll fail. He does make class engaging but participation is important.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: TAKE HIM! This class isn't super easy but he makes it so fun! He really cares about you learning and was always so available for help. Gives great feedback and wants you to succeed. Show up to class and you will do great!

TAKE HIM!! He is a pretty tough grader but it is a class you will definitely pass. He really cares about his students and their success. He gives LOTS of feedback that really helps you improve for next time. You don't have to show up to class but it really helps because he will go over everything in class that isn't necessarily on D2L.

Honestly I don't get why people say this is the hardest Communication class, it was pretty easy. The only issue I had was the professor. He's a critic with no remorse for the words I chose like it was his way or the highway. But he did make me learn from my mistakes, though, and he's a good professor and a great communicator. I recommend him.

Prof Latino is great! There's hardly any homework and assignments are like 2 weeks apart and don't take super long. He gives great feedback on in-class assignments and is easy to email. Only book required was like $53 but the AP stylebook he gives you a link to. Take him!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: I had Professor Latino for PR 3375 (PR Writing) and he was great! The class can be a little difficult as you're basically working on a media kit throughout the entire semester, but the workload never felt overwhelming and Professor Latino did a good job of making that happen.

Professor Latino is very caring and wants you to succeed. Just make sure you stay on top of notes and what he goes over and class and you should be good. Using the things I learned in his class in my current job so definitely would take again.

Prof. Latino is probably my favorite professor ever taken. Lots of in-class work so he can help you, and some homework over the weekends. The class was much easier as long as you show up. I don't believe you could have a better instructor for any course than him. I think we had like 15 assignments in total.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Prof. Latino is great on every aspect and is incredibly organized. He is definitely the one to take for an online classes. However the exams for this class cover incredibly specific content from the textbook which is impossible to find in the little time assigned. Get the e-book so you can find it faster!

COM 2135 was the hardest course ever, his lectures are heavy. I believe that a professor's teaching method makes the student performs better in the course. I don't recommend taking him as a professor. I Left his class confused and not able to understand anything. he will help you fix your mistakes on his assignments.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Latino's class was a lot of fun! It was online so I never got to meet him in person, but he was always very kind and caring when I communicated with him over email. The class included weekly discussion posts and quizzes, but nothing was ever difficult and assignments were explained well.

Professor Latino will teach you how to write - full stop. I struggled in this class, but Latino was always available to meet and happily provided feedback. This is one of those few classes where I really feel I got my money's worth.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Peter Latino is an all-around great professor. He's very approachable and cares about his students. H knows his stuff, having been a newspaper reporter for several years. If you're really committed to a journalism career, this is your guy. Look out for small anomalies, like assignments not updated for the latest changes in the AP Stylebook.

A tough class but he makes it manageable after working really hard and focusing on AP style and workbook practices. Although he is a tough grader, he is very clear with his feedback. He wants everyone to do good and is very understanding and reachable.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: He might be good in person, but do not take this man as an online instructor. Gives you ZERO useful feedback on his mark-up sessions. His lectures are painful to listen to and give little instruction. He wants to you look up things in the AP style book, but gives you 10 minutes for a 15 question quiz where you are having to write out the answers.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Great professor who really encourages his students to try their best, but also helps them try their best. Very understanding of personal situations and really cares about students. My favorite professor this semester.

The class itself is hard not matter what but he makes it easier. He does grade hard but it is fair and you can see where you went wrong. He is a great teacher and loves when you ask questions. He gives plenty of practice in class and outside of class. Get the books!

Professor Latino is easily one of the very best professors I have ever taken. He is extremely knowledgeable and has great real world experience, and his recorded lectures are always helpful in explaining the course material. He prepares students well for their assignments and always gives helpful feedback within a day or two. Take him if you can!
You have to do your best from start to finish to get a B or A in his class but its possible! He will help you, I am NOT a writer but I did ok after all of his consistant help.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Amazing man in general. He is a bit of a hard grader but wants you to succeed and will help you do so. Very much enjoyed my time in this class and high recommend anyone take this professor.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: The online class was very manageable. My only problem was that I would get points off for things that I had no clue were required in the discussion posts.

Professor Latino is a great teacher. He has no problem taking time out to help with difficult assignments. DO NOT underestimate this class. The class was pretty challenging and you definitely have to work for your grade.

Professor Latino is one of the best professors I have taken at KSU. He really makes you work for your grade and you really learn a lot from his class. He is easy to get in touch with outside of class. Fully recommend him just be ready to work hard.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Latino is tough but fair. He's a very picky grader when it comes to AP style but he's also very helpful and easily accessible outside of class. Nice guy, tough grader.

From the beginning, he explains that this class is one of the hardest classes. As a teacher, he explains well. he's a tough grader which is fine due to the nature of the class. The feedback helps you do better on the next assignments so pay attention.

Pete Latino is one of the best professors I've had at KSU. This course changed my entire perspective on public writing. There are no tests, few quizzes and the rest of the assignments are writing. During class its mostly lecture and practice, and usually one assignment per week. Great class, I highly recommend it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Would take again

comment: One of the best professors I've ever had. You definitely have to work hard in this class but he's very supportive and cares about how you're doing. He's very intentional about getting to know his students and seeing them be successful. His class really made me want to go into journalism.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Professor Latino is one of the best professors I've had. He is passionate about writing and gives excellent feedback. He is willing to work with you but you need to seek him out. I learned a ton in this class and it really sparked my love for journalism. NEVER MISS CLASS!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I took Latino for an online class and I really hated it. There are discussion posts every week and quizzes most weeks. Those aren't too hard. It's the tests that killed me. I could not pass them no matter how hard are studied. You have to pay attention to the little details or you wont pass. Good luck if you take him online.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: One of my favorite professors at KSU! He is very helpful as well as knowledgeable in what he is teaching. I 100 % recommend him for Writing for Public Communications!

He is very helpful during class and will come around to each student  to critique their work. He also gives useful feedback on the graded assignments ,which helps to prevent repetitive errors. He is clear about his expectations on assignments, and as long as students stick to AP style, they will be okay. Just show up to class and participate!
I took the 7-week version of the writing class. Very challenging, and lots of work in a short period, but if you show up every class and listen to the feedback he gives you, you will do well.
Had him for a seven-week course. AP Stylebook is crucial as well as being able to properly use AP Style. I enjoyed his class, he's very clear and his feedback definitely helps.

Professor Latino is great! I took this as a 7 week class and he was very helpful. Very clear when it comes to explaining AP style and gives tons of examples and practice exercises. Gives great feedback on your work and it helps you improve on future assignments. AP stylebook is a MUST. Pay attention and follow the rubric and you should be solid!

He's a nice teacher. Pretty clear and the class is pretty small and offers help & will work with you if you ask for it. Make sure you get BOTH books, including the AP Style book, you will absolutely need it.

I absolutely loved Professor Latino. He is a tough grader but only because he has had a full career in PR and wants to prepare you for that. His feedback is very direct on all assignments and he will always give you honest feedback. Very small point system so make sure you do your best on all assignments (easy points on quizzes).

I took him for PR Writing. The class isn't that hard, you just have to triple check to make sure everything is in AP style. You complete a media kit but he breaks it down so it's not all due at once, which I appreciated. It was a hybrid so all the quizzes were online and straight from his powerpoints and lectures. I didn't use the book at all.

Class is very hard, i have never taken any class so tough in my college career. I feel lost even when he explains it. You better be on your P&Qs with him. He doesnt care what grade you thought you deserve. Basically he is the GRAVE KEEPER not the GRADE GIVER. Dont take it if you want to fail.

I have taken him for another class and I really don't understand how his ratings are so high. I am a hard working AB student and this class was horrible. He reads directly off the powerpoint slides, his lectures are not engaging at all, he is more worried about petty grading than you actually learning, and he goes against what the book says!

Pay attention and it's an easy A. Goof off and you'll be lost. Bookstore says the "Rules for Writers" book is required, but it was a waste of money, we never used it, he never mentioned it. The Grindel book is required for some in-class work. The Stylebook is a MUST, and you can use it during tests. Surprisingly interesting class and great teacher.

I really enjoyed this class. I am not a writer in the least and Professor Latino really took the time to help me out. Whenever I had a question or a concern about the assignment, he was always willing to help. I would take him for any class in a heartbeat!

The class seems really easy, but he grades kinda toughly, so if you don't pay attention to detail, it's really easy to lose a lot of points. He's not very clear on what he wants in terms of writing, but he does have tutoring sessions where you could ask for more help.

Best class ever. Super easy if you pay attention and follow directions. Some people don't know how to do either so who knows how they even got here in the first place. I made an A but others weren't so lucky. Maybe it's just my thing.
This is a hard class. Must pay attention and go to class. Tough grader and not many grades. You earn the grade you get.

VERY HARD CLASS designed to weed out comm majors!!!!! You will for sure earn your grade in here. However, He is the most kind, helpful professor I've had at this school. After this class I decided Communication isnt for me but I did well and I learned a ton of material from this guy. He teaches alot and does it well! VERY TOUGH GRADER but worth it!

You will definitely learn in his class.  Initially he's a TOUGH grader but once you get the just of what he expects you'll see improvements in your grades.  He's always available to answer questions and give feedback which is awesome!  I'd take him again and would surely recommend him.

Go to class!!! You either pass the class or you don't.  You can't make up late assignments, there is no dropping the lowest grade, and no extra credit.  Part of me thinks he makes the class harder than necessary but he's very clear on what he wants and what to expect.

Very thorough.  He can be a little intimidating at first because he is sooo thorough but as you get to know him you'll really like him.  GO TO CLASS.  Attendance is not mandatory but you'll hate yourself for not going.  he is ery tough grader.  You will definitely earn your grade in this class.  Overall he's a great professor.  I'd take him again.

I like him as a person. He's so nice and is always willing to help and he will sit with you and go over papers, etc....I love that about him. However, his class is VERY HARD! He grades very tough, its sort of expected but still, he could ease up for sure.
Great professor. Super easy and very helpful. You must follow directions, pay attention, attend class, and use common sense. You will pass if you do all of these things.
really nice guy! knows what he is teaching and really is very helpful if you do not understand. you need to go to class but a lot of the news you read is quite interesting!

I was concerned about this class based on previous comments BUT I was pleasantly surprised.  He is a GREAT teacher and very clear.  He does expect you to pay attention, attend class, and do your work.  Not for slackers but and EXCELLENT TEACHER!!!
Mr. Latino was a great professor! I took Human Comm with him and I really enjoyed it. We did a lot of group activities which were challenging but fun. He's hot and helpful.
Hes not that bad. There are quite a few assignments but nothing like writing long papers. You will actually learn in this class

Slackers need not apply...Prof Latino is tough, I'm not going to lie, but his knowledge of the material and his willingness to help more than make up for this. You need to come to class every day and one time, if not, you'll never pass. He expects a lot from his students but does everything he can to help. I HIGHLY recommend Prof Latino!

Professor Latino is fair with grades. This is not an easy class but if you do well in his class you will do well in the rest of your writing classes.  I found him to be extremely helpful and engaged. I enjoyed his class.  I ended up with an 87 because of stupid AP errors. If I had given this class more attention I could've earned an A.

Latino was by no means easy, however knew what he was doing.  I have learned more through one semester of his class than my entire college experience thus far. Extremely fair with grades and always willing to help.

Latino is very friendly and fair with grades.  The work is not easy but it is helpful.  His class periods are typically short because he likes to get all the lecture and classwork knocked out without wasting time in between, which is great.  Class is enjoyable.

Latino does not care about you not understanding the material.  Make sure you show up to class and show up on time.  He contradicts himself all the time.  Here's a quote from his syllabus...  "I am the grade keeper, not the grade giver".  BEWARE!

Latino does not care about you not understanding the material.  Make sure you show up to class and show up on time.  He contradicts himself all the time.  Here's a quote from his syllabus...  "I am he grade keeper, not the grade giver".  BEWARE!
Doesn't seem interested in teaching. He doesn't teach the subject matter very well and is a stringent grader.

While attendance is not mandatory, there are a lot of group assignments.  Be prepared to spend time out of class to work with your group.  Lectures are monotone and STRAIGHT from the power point.  No study guides avail for exams.
Mr. Latino was very hands on.  This class is not an easy A, but you learn alot.
I learned alot from Mr. Latino.  He made you work for your grade and he is very hands on.

I took him for writing this semester. You need to attend class to understand information and some assignments are due by end of class. He wasn't *easy* but he teaches very well. I didn't buy the book- but you MUST get the AP book. He was pretty monotone~ but you actually do learn. The grammar exercises were a piece of cake.Take him if you want an A
